properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:15AM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Afternoon through
Saturday...

A strong storm system will approach the region late tonight into
Friday with rainfall overspreading much of northeast and east
central Kansas. Temperatures will rapidly fall during the
afternoon and evening hours Friday, transitioning precipitation
to a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet. All precipitation is
expected to transition to snow by sunrise Saturday morning, with
periods of moderate to heavy snow continuing through Saturday
afternoon.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of up to
one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Douglas, Osage, Franklin, Coffey and Anderson Counties.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two waves are expected from this system.
The first is expected to bring a mix of snow, sleet, and
freezing rain this afternoon and evening. There may be a lull
overnight before the second wave brings all snow to the area
Saturday morning and afternoon.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY
